text:
Answer concisely (1–2 sentences):
What did the Emancipation Proclamation do?
The Emancipation Proclamation was a proclamation issued by President Abraham Lincoln on January 1, 1863, that declared that all slaves in Confederate states were to be freed.
The proclamation was issued in response to the Confederate States of America's refusal to accept the terms of the Treaty of Fort Jackson, which had been signed by Union General Ulysses S. Grant on December 2
